text:
- [Narrator] Customers
around the world already

trust Amazon GuardDuty
to continuously monitor
AWS accounts and workloads

for potential malicious activity
and anomalous behaviors.

Now, Amazon GuardDuty
offers malware protection

to help find malware
and Amazon EC2 instance

and container workloads
without using software agents.
If you're a new GuardDuty customer,

malware protection is
automatically turned on
when you sign up.

If you're an existing customer,
it only takes a single click
in your AWS console to enable it.

Once enabled, Amazon GuardDuty
only scans Amazon EBS volumes
from the EC2 instances exhibiting behavior
indicative of malware.

Both malware and other GuardDuty
findings are aggregated,
delivering an enriched

and contextualized single
source threat detection view.

This information helps
security teams quickly

and accurately identify
and remediate malware
and other security concerns.

Because GuardDuty is integrated
with services such as AWS

Security Hub, Amazon
EventBridge, and Amazon Detective
these findings can also be routed
to the proper administrators
and initiate automated remediation.
Start your free 30 day trial
of Amazon GuardDuty Malware Protection

for agentless detection of
malware on AWS workloads today.
